result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence James Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence James Carter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrence James Carter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
As to both counts:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months as to each count in the House of Correction, concurrent with each other,  with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months, concurrent with each other,  with the following conditions:
- Agent to determine if the defendant is to complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim. No modification of the order unless the victim agrees to it and it is approved by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.  No DNA or DV surcharge on this case.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Terrence James Carter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
This case was calendared for a sentencing hearing today.  
The victim in this case informed the district attorney that the defendant was at her house yesterday.  In addition, there is a district attorney arrest warrant on case 15CM3937.  The Sheriff's Department was unable to find the arrest warrant and the defendant was released and told to report to out of custody intake court to clear the warrant.
State needs time to investigate the new allegations.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence James Carter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Peter Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a jury trial today.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
As to both counts:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36
.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence James Carter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The defendant was late to court yesterday and defense counsel never returned yesterday afternoon.  The court had issued a bench warrant but then withdrew it when the defendant appeared.
Case was calendared for a jury trial yesterday and the defendant wants another jury trial date in Branch 36.
The defendant was informed that there will be no negotiations and none of the counts will be dismissed on the jury trial date.
The court imposed costs for the police officers sitting in court yesterday waiting for the defendant to appear.

  Jury trial scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence James Carter in court with attorney Jeffrey Schwartz.  Peter Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Attorney Lamke never returned to the court.  Attorney Schwartz is representing the defendant.  Court ordered warrant withdrawn and bail reinstated.
Case calendared for a status date in Branch 36 on 10/29/2015 at 08:30 a.m..
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.

cab
 Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the commissioner upon return on the bench warrant.
The court also assessed $100.00 for the officers' time waiting in court.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
 Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the commissioner upon return on the bench warrant.
The court also assessed $100.00 for the officers' time waiting in court.

Defendant Terrence James Carter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
State's Witness List received and filed.
Case is calendared for a final pretrial today.  The defense informs the court that they are leaving it on for trial on 10/28/2015 at 08:30 a.m.
State revokes all offers.

Defendant Terrence James Carter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
 Scheduling conference held.  Court adjourned case for final pretrial conference and  jury trial in Branch 36.
State's motion for joinder of both cases granted by the court.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence James Carter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding joinder. State requested a joinder motion to further investigate matter.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case set for Motion Hearing in branch 36.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence James Carter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Defense counsel requests case be set for a status conference. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

07-01-15

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ebonie M

Defendant Terrence James Carter in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Terrence James Carter in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case of which these charges stem, this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
